bill_title: appropriate money for an education pilot project.

bill_versions.bill_text: FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to appropriate money for an education pilot project. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. There is hereby appropriated from the general fund the sum of three hundred thousand dollars ($300,000), or so much thereof as may be necessary, to the Department of Education for a grant to the Rapid City school district to implement a three-year pilot project to address the specific educational needs of Native American students. The Rapid City school district shall work with the Department of Education to design the pilot project and its methods to address the educational needs of Native American students. Section 2. The secretary of the Department of Education shall approve vouchers and the state auditor shall draw warrants to pay expenditures authorized by this Act. Section 3. Any amounts appropriated in this Act not lawfully expended or obligated by June 30, 2007, shall revert in accordance with § 4-8-21. 350 copies of this document were printed by the South Dakota Legislative Research Council at a cost of $.027 per page. . Insertions into existing statutes are indicated by underscores. Deletions from existing statutes are indicated by overstrikes.
